title: Camille vs. Warwick | Lore
body:
https://imgur.com/BCMiKqV

---

#What would happen if Camille happened to encounter Warwick while on a mission in Zaun?

---

Both Camille and Warwick are the last people you want after you in the dual city-states of Piltover and Zaun. Lore-wise they are very similar despite being from two very different cities. 

Camille Ferros ensures the Piltover machine and its Zaunite underbelly runs smoothly while Warwick runs rampant in the streets of Zaun preying on criminals who terrorize the city’s depths. Nevertheless, both of their bodies have undergone massive transformations either through Hextech Technology or DNA-Splicing leaving them to preforms similar feats.

---

{{champion:164}} 
##Camille lore
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/champion/camille/

{{champion:19}} 
##Warwick lore
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/champion/warwick/

replies.body:
Oh man.

This hits close to home.  We had to answer this very question for ourselves on a project that unfortunately got scrapped.  Our team has an opinion of exactly what happens when these two meet.  This was probably one of the most fun meetings we've ever had at work.

Thanks for the nostalgia trip. :)
Was the scrapped project the vs event? :o
Haha unfortunately I am not part of the skins team.  But I wouldn't be opposed to seeing them make that one day.
I cannot say for this particular project, but one day we'll revisit the cities!
Then what was it? :c
Versus event Iâ€™m guessing

My take on it is that it's a landslide victory for one party over the other.

But... it's not a set in stone kind of thing. :)
does this mean that the team *behinds the scene* ships this pairing? cuz it sounds painful, so very, very painful.

Mundo wins.

"But Ebonmaw, he is not included in this topic"

I dont care, Mundo goes where he pleases.

> [{quoted}](name=Ebonmaw Dragon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=wdK8H5qy,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-08-16T22:53:23.435+0000)
>
> Mundo wins.
> 
> "But Ebonmaw, he is not included in this topic"
> 
> I dont care, Mundo goes where he pleases.

LOL

If they can throw literally anything in their power into the ring, then Camille wins for me, no doubt.
She is basically in charge of her house, which is one of the biggest and most influential in Piltover.
If necessary, she could probably mobilise a little army to fight him, she has scientists at her side to design weapons against him and so on.

If it's basically a surprise encounter, then it's closer. I would still slightly give Camille the edge, she is highly intelligent and has great tools and experience, she could possibly find a way to abuse Warwicks bestialic nature.

Sorry it's a surprise encounter, I edited it and made the question more clear.

Warwick has beast-like tendencies*. Remember, it was a failed experiment and he also use to be a gangster. He may lash out at the scent of blood which Camille most likely has little of so hey may approach the situation more intelligently.

I would also imagine Warwick has more brute strength than Camille seeing as he can easily rip apart a metal door.
Camille is however, more agile, strategic, and possibly more experienced. She also has shields at her disposal, which I don't see Warwick tearing through very easily.

Why would you think Camille is more agile?

Warwick is a lot faster, has regeneration and claws that can hold her legs. If he holds, one bite of her head is certain death.

Because Warwick doesn't need to be agile since he heals so fast. Meanwhile we've seen Camille dodge attacks from multiple enemies while fighting. She needs to be agile because she can't take as much damage without her shield active all the time (which I'm sure takes  a lot of power). So she has to be capable of dodging multiple attacks while systematically eliminating each threat. 

Warwick on the other hand, is more the type to just dive right into the middle of the fray and tear people apart while tanking all their attacks. Hell, you can even see this in their gameplay. Warwick heals a lot and has an ability to reduce in coming damage so he can dive into enemy lines and tear them apart. While Camille's kit isn't nearly as good for prolonged fights, so she needs to get in, quickly and efficiently kill her target and then get out.
well, does Camille bleed still? if not then that's a massive advantage against Warwick. Plus her mobility is far greater than Warwick who relies on leaping while Camille has her hookshot.

I dont doubt that camille would win the initial bout but she doesnt have full knowledge to the extent of warwicks modifications and a big part of what makes warwick, warwick is his durability. I could absolutely see camille leave warwick with enough wounds that no mortal creature should still live, likely at the loss of one of her tools(her grappling hooks or her shield) because warwick is a "champion" in his own right and then getting taken by surprise when he pushes past it and gets on top of her. 

ultimately theyre both hunters in their own right and it could be as simple as who finds who first. Though even despite that id consider it more likely that warwick would walk away from a loss than camille would. Zaun is no place for an injured piltover elite to be.

I like Camille more but my vote is Warwick. He has more brutal force, is faster, and unlike many, I don't forget the fact Warwick is not stupid. He is also intelligent. Funny people here acts like Warwick is complete beast. 

Intelligence in many fight cases don't matter, especially when you are not prepared. A human wouldn't survive against a hyena just because human is more clever.

Again let's not undermine Camille though. Just imagine what type of augmentations she has on her legs which would leave her only slightly weaker.

Warwick still has his beast-like tendencies when he smells blood. I'm confident Camille still has blood or else he skin wouldn't have that colour so Warwick were able to cut her he would probably turn into a complete animal but becoming even more volatile.

Warwick has augmentations too.

His blood mode makes him even stronger though. His less control is balanced by more raw power at that moment.

Unless Camille aims his head, he will always be in advantage when both takes damage. Camille is still human in the end. She will be tired, be in pain etc.

Warwick has more chance imo.

Camille's legs are more than likely to almost be able to cut Warwick completely in half and Camille has undergone multiple surgeries so I doubt she would get tired or be in pain. She's almost full machine.

Then why would she need precision and preparation if she is "that strong"?

Camille, even though has brutal force, is mastered in her tactics, strategies. Her main weapon is her intelligent. Warwick on the other hand is built for brutal force and his main weapon is his brutal force, of course. 

For that reason, if Camille is prepared, she is likely the one that is winner, if she is not , winner is Warwick.

That's what seperates them, what makes them unique. If Camille is superior in both brutal force and strategy, what makes Warwick unique and not completely garbage? 

You guys really hard try to make Warwick completely trash in every single domain. Useless predator that can't even kill a augmented human when she is not even prepared, which is her main trait...

The whole point is it's a surprise encounter. Camille is incredibly adaptable as well, I'm not pulling this out of my ass you can go check her bio.

Although Camille can deal a lot of damage to Warwick, Warwick is more than capable of ripping Camille apart like paper if he gets a good hold of her, go look at the cinematic and see what he did to that metal door. He's also incredibly volatile which can through a lot of logic out of the way when he beasts out. Camille has definitely dealt with thugs and threats from Zaun before but Warwick is definelty on her level.

> The whole point is it's a surprise encounter.

That's why I say Warwick wins. If it was prepared fight, then Camille would be the winner.

Warwick has high chance to Camille even before she spills his blood. And his being out of control is not an insta win for Camille...

As in surprise encounter I mean as in like they first see eachother then start fighting.

I never said Warwick beasting out made Camille win. If anything it makes him even more of a threat.

I'm quite sure that she would avoid him if given any choice in the matter at all.

I'd have to pick Camille. This is essentially a conflict between a precise and highly mobile individual used to out-thinking her opponents and a brute with feral cunning and raw strength on its side but a tendency to fall into a blind frenzy when the red mist descends. Failing any unfortunate accidents, one would have to presume that Camille could use her speed and easy access to vertical space to outmaneuver Warwick while landing attacks of opportunity until exhaustion, frustration or overwhelming bloodlust forced him to make a fatal error. She has no need to meet him in a head-on confrontation that isn't taking place on her terms and her altered physiology presumably means that she's more than capable waiting while out of his reach for extended periods of time. 

Putting this on Warwick's turf might hand him something of an advantage, but then that really brings things back to my first point: Camille isn't going to fight someone unless she is the one in control and she's absolutely going to push that edge right to the hilt. The only real chance I can see Warwick having would either be thanks to a freak accident or Camille's sense of superiority leading her to under-estimate him and gift him an opening.

First the whole point of the post is who would win in a fight in the streets of Zaun and Camille has been put in many unfavourable situations and still fought and come out on top.

Although Zaun is Warwick's turf who says Camille has no knowledge of Zaun? She's practically all over the dual city-states all the time which she would probably still put her at a disadvantage since Warwick is down there all the time but not as severe as you make it out to be.

I love {{champion:164}} more
"Precision is the difference between a butcher, and a surgeon."
Gotta love the wisdom that a robotic british accent can bring.

> [{quoted}](name=destroyer22719,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=wdK8H5qy,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-08-16T23:16:11.113+0000)
>

> "Precision is the difference between a butcher, and a surgeon."
> Gotta love the wisdom that a robotic british accent can bring.

Sure, but Mundo is a Doctor who performs surgeries like a butcher.

He wins.
How does The Butcher beat The Surgeon though?

> [{quoted}](name=Ahpe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=wdK8H5qy,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-08-17T00:25:37.886+0000)
>
> How does The Butcher beat The Surgeon though?

Well, one of those has the job of killing things, the other is supposed to save people. So, the one that kills should win.

But Mundo saves people by killing them, so, he wins

My guess is that Camille would bail on the first fight if she happened across Warwick while on a different mission. He's irrelevant to her goals, and unless he's actively preventing her from accomplishing them there's no reason to waste time fighting him. Conversely, provided Warwick wasn't in a blood rage or had a bone to pick with Camille, he'd have no reason to chase her. 

If they met for a second time - this time intentionally - Camille would likely come out ahead. Following the initial encounter, Camille would gain as much information about Warwick as possible and know exactly how to defeat him once it came to blows. Sure, Warwick is a tough opponent, but I think he's outmatched here. It's like fighting Batman if you give him prep time.

It largely depends on who finds who first. The longer Camille has to observe a foe, the better she can plan her attack. Give her enough time and she may very well figure out, say, that that chemtech thing on Warwick's back isn't just for enhancement. If Camille sees Warwick first, she can map out and/or predict his behavior and cut him to ribbons. Warwick is simply too simplistic; once you understand his behavior he's basically a wolf with no pack.

OTOH, If Warwick finds Camille first, then Camille has no time to plan and Warwick will tear her to shreds; lore-wise she's an assassin, not a frontline warrior. Now, Camille fans may argue (with justification) that Camille is an assassin and knows how to keep hidden. And she does; from PEOPLE and HEXTECH. Warwick hunts by smell, especially the scent of blood. But Camille doesn't necessarily know how good that sense of smell is and she certainly doesn't have much experience dealing with it (her primary prey - humans - rely on their sight and hearing FAR more than their sense of smell).
No one gets the jump on eachother, it's a head on fight and Camille is perfectly capable of brawling lore-wise.

With a werewolf chimera that has a healing factor?

There's a difference between knowing how to fight and being LITERALLY MADE FOR IT. Camille's augmented body is made for stealthy traversal and assassination, not frontline engagements.

EDIT: And if it's a head on fight, Camille has no time to prepare or plan anyway, and she still loses for the reasons outlined above.

Do you think Camille would only augment her body for assassinations? What if was seen and was forced into a fight? Camille will think a head and literally in her bio says she's adaptable. Sure, Warwick will be a huge pain in the ass to deal with but Camille is definitely prepared for almost any situation.

>Do you think Camille would only augment her body for assassinations?

Yes.

Because that is literally her job and she wants to be as good at it as possible.

"Just in case" isn't good enough against a monster like Warwick.

>Camille will think a head and literally in her bio says she's adaptable.

I'm assuming here that this is the first time Camille and Warwick run into each other. You can't think ahead for a situation that you don't know will happen.

Camille think's ahead and she's an intelligencer, she has info. If she's frequently going in and out of Zaun don't you think she would know of Warwick? It's not like his existence is hidden from the world.

>If she's frequently going in and out of Zaun don't you think she would know of Warwick?

Knowing that there are tales of a psychotic werewolf running through the streets is not the same thing as knowing how to fight said werewolf.

Next time don't cut the first part out

> [{quoted}](name=Ahpe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=wdK8H5qy,comment-id=000900000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-19T19:46:28.665+0000)
>
> Camille think's ahead and she's an intelligencer, she has info.

Why not? It doesn't change my answer in the slightest.

She can't "think ahead" if she doesn't know the thing exists, so it's irrelevant. Being an intelligencer is also irrelevant, unless you're arguing they know all about Singed's experiments; more than even he does, for that matter (which would be one hell of a claim)

It just looked liked you cherry picked something from my comment to make your retort look better.

And you can't tell me that after awhile nobody will hear of a chimeric wolf going around killing criminals.

>It just looked liked you cherry picked something from my comment to make your retort look better.

*shrug* I didn't, it just wasn't relevant.

>And you can't tell me that after awhile nobody will hear of a chimeric wolf going around killing criminals.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

Me, earlier:

>Knowing that there are tales of a psychotic werewolf running through the streets is not the same thing as knowing how to fight said werewolf.

She's adaptable and she. thinks. ahead.

Why would she not be prepared to deal with a high-threat chimeric wolf while going in and out of Zaun?

And explain to me why word of a chimeric wolf won't spread.
